text: This is a list of countries where Dutch or Afrikaans are official languages. ==Countries== Country Population 2011See: List of countries and dependencies by population Speakers Speakers Notes Country Population 2011See: List of countries and dependencies by population L1Eurobarometer 2012 - Annex L2 Notes Dutch 17,116,000 16,431,360 (96%) 687,000 (4%) De facto national language Afrikaans 51,770,000 6,860,000 (14%) 10,300,000 (19%) De jure nationwide co- official language Dutch 11,303,000 6,215,000 (55%) 1,469,000 (13%) De jure nationwide co- official language (majority language in Flemish Region and minority in Brussels-Capital Region) Dutch 540,000 325,000 (60%) 215,000 (40%) De jure sole nationwide official language Afrikaans 2,113,000 220,000 (10,4%) lingua franca Recognized national language Total 82,834,000 29,069,000 12,671,000+ ==Dependent territories== ===Dutch=== ====Belgium==== Region Status Other official languages Region French Region Region French, German ====Netherlands==== Region Status Other official languages Constituent country Papiamento Municipality Papiamento Constituent country Papiamento English Province West Frisian Municipality English Municipality English Constituent country English ===Afrikaans=== ====South Africa==== Region Status Other official languages Northern Cape Province English Setswana Xhosa Western Cape Province English Xhosa ==International institutions== Institution Afrikaans official?
